trans-unit.source: Steps to follow when you retire or change the name of an ACOM technical article
trans-unit.target: Steps to follow when you retire or change the name of an ACOM technical article

trans-unit.source: This guidance is for SMEs who are listed as the author of an article that needs to be retired from the technical documentation section of azure.microsoft.com.
trans-unit.target: This guidance is for SMEs who are listed as the author of an article that needs to be retired from the technical documentation section of azure.microsoft.com.

trans-unit.source: The steps also apply if a file is renamed.
trans-unit.target: The steps also apply if a file is renamed.

trans-unit.source: If you're a member of our Azure community and you think an article should be retired for any reason, please leave a comment in the Disqus comment stream for the article to let the author know something is wrong with the article.
trans-unit.target: If you're a member of our Azure community and you think an article should be retired for any reason, please leave a comment in the Disqus comment stream for the article to let the author know something is wrong with the article.

trans-unit.source: SME authors need to follow several steps to gracefully retire content so users of the website don't have a bad experience when we retire content from the site.
trans-unit.target: SME authors need to follow several steps to gracefully retire content so users of the website don't have a bad experience when we retire content from the site.

trans-unit.source: Deleting the article or changing it’s name should be the last thing that happens!
trans-unit.target: Deleting the article or changing it’s name should be the last thing that happens!

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Manage inbound links
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Manage inbound links

trans-unit.source: Determine if there are any non-Microsoft inbound links to your content.
trans-unit.target: Determine if there are any non-Microsoft inbound links to your content.

trans-unit.source: Frequently, blogs, forums, and other content on the web points to articles.
trans-unit.target: Frequently, blogs, forums, and other content on the web points to articles.

trans-unit.source: Frequently, you can work with blog owners to change these links, and you can remove or update links from forum posts.
trans-unit.target: Frequently, you can work with blog owners to change these links, and you can remove or update links from forum posts.

trans-unit.source: Web analytics tools can tell you if there are any high traffic inbound links you might need to manage in this way.
trans-unit.target: Web analytics tools can tell you if there are any high traffic inbound links you might need to manage in this way.

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Remove all crosslinks to the article from the technical content repository
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Remove all crosslinks to the article from the technical content repository

trans-unit.source: Ensure you are working in an up-to-date local branch – run `git pull upstream master` (or the appropriate variation on this command.
trans-unit.target: Ensure you are working in an up-to-date local branch – run `git pull upstream master` (or the appropriate variation on this command.

trans-unit.source: Scan the azure-content-pr/articles folder and the azure-content-pr/includes folder for any articles and includes that link to the article you want to retire, and either remove the crosslinks or replace them with an appropriate new crosslinks.
trans-unit.target: Scan the azure-content-pr/articles folder and the azure-content-pr/includes folder for any articles and includes that link to the article you want to retire, and either remove the crosslinks or replace them with an appropriate new crosslinks.

trans-unit.source: You can use a search and replace utility to find the crosslinks if you have one installed.
trans-unit.target: You can use a search and replace utility to find the crosslinks if you have one installed.

trans-unit.source: If you don't, you can use Windows PowerShell for free!
trans-unit.target: If you don't, you can use Windows PowerShell for free!

trans-unit.source: Here's how to use PowerShell to find the crosslinks:
trans-unit.target: Here's how to use PowerShell to find the crosslinks:

trans-unit.source: a.
trans-unit.target: a.

trans-unit.source: Start Windows PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: Start Windows PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: b.
trans-unit.target: b.

trans-unit.source: At the PowerShell prompt, change into the azure-content-pr\articles folder:
trans-unit.target: At the PowerShell prompt, change into the azure-content-pr\articles folder:

trans-unit.source: c.
trans-unit.target: c.

trans-unit.source: Type this command, which will list all files that contain a reference to the article you are deleting:
trans-unit.target: Type this command, which will list all files that contain a reference to the article you are deleting:

trans-unit.source: If you prefer to send the list of file names to a text file (in this case, named psoutput.txt), you can:
trans-unit.target: If you prefer to send the list of file names to a text file (in this case, named psoutput.txt), you can:

trans-unit.source: Add and commit all your changes, push them to your fork, and create a pull request to move your changes from your fork to the master branch of the main repository.
trans-unit.target: Add and commit all your changes, push them to your fork, and create a pull request to move your changes from your fork to the master branch of the main repository.

trans-unit.source: Step 3: Update the FWLink tool
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Update the FWLink tool

trans-unit.source: Check the FWLink tool for any FWLinks that might point to the article.
trans-unit.target: Check the FWLink tool for any FWLinks that might point to the article.

trans-unit.source: Point any FWLinks at replacement content; if you are not on the alias that owns the link, join it.
trans-unit.target: Point any FWLinks at replacement content; if you are not on the alias that owns the link, join it.

trans-unit.source: If the owners won't update the link, file a ticket with MSCOM to have the link changed.
trans-unit.target: If the owners won't update the link, file a ticket with MSCOM to have the link changed.

trans-unit.source: More info - [internal wiki](http://sharepoint/sites/azurecontentguidance/wiki/Pages/Manage%20inbound%20links%20to%20retired%20topics.aspx).
trans-unit.target: More info - [internal wiki](http://sharepoint/sites/azurecontentguidance/wiki/Pages/Manage%20inbound%20links%20to%20retired%20topics.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Step 4: Remove all crosslinks to the article from other pages on azure.microsoft.com and create a redirect for the retired page, if appropriate
trans-unit.target: Step 4: Remove all crosslinks to the article from other pages on azure.microsoft.com and create a redirect for the retired page, if appropriate

trans-unit.source: You'll have to work with the person who maintains and updates the documentation landing page for your service for this part.
trans-unit.target: You'll have to work with the person who maintains and updates the documentation landing page for your service for this part.

trans-unit.source: Contact your content team partner if you don't know who that person is.
trans-unit.target: Contact your content team partner if you don't know who that person is.

trans-unit.source: The person who maintains and updates the doc landing page will need to do two things:
trans-unit.target: The person who maintains and updates the doc landing page will need to do two things:

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, scan the **entire** ACOM web solution for cross references to the file to retire.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, scan the **entire** ACOM web solution for cross references to the file to retire.

trans-unit.source: Remove the cross references, or replace them with an updated cross reference.
trans-unit.target: Remove the cross references, or replace them with an updated cross reference.

trans-unit.source: You'll need to remove the HTML links as well as the related resource strings for the HTML links.
trans-unit.target: You'll need to remove the HTML links as well as the related resource strings for the HTML links.

trans-unit.source: More info - see the [internal wiki](http://sharepoint/sites/azurecontentguidance/wiki/Pages/Create%20or%20edit%20a%20service%20landing%20page%20or%20left%20nav.aspx)
trans-unit.target: More info - see the [internal wiki](http://sharepoint/sites/azurecontentguidance/wiki/Pages/Create%20or%20edit%20a%20service%20landing%20page%20or%20left%20nav.aspx)

trans-unit.source: If a replacement article exists, create a redirect.
trans-unit.target: If a replacement article exists, create a redirect.

trans-unit.source: More info - see the [internal wiki](http://sharepoint/sites/azurecontentguidance/wiki/Pages/Remove%20published%20pages%20and%20request%20redirects.aspx).
trans-unit.target: More info - see the [internal wiki](http://sharepoint/sites/azurecontentguidance/wiki/Pages/Remove%20published%20pages%20and%20request%20redirects.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Check the changes into the repository.
trans-unit.target: Check the changes into the repository.

trans-unit.source: Step 5: Retire the article
trans-unit.target: Step 5: Retire the article

trans-unit.source: After you've completed the three prior steps and those changes are live, then you can delete the article from the repository.
trans-unit.target: After you've completed the three prior steps and those changes are live, then you can delete the article from the repository.

trans-unit.source: Step 6: Remove links from MSDN
trans-unit.target: Step 6: Remove links from MSDN

trans-unit.source: Review the content QA tool for broken links to the retired or renamed topic and remove/fix the links in all MSDN topics affected.
trans-unit.target: Review the content QA tool for broken links to the retired or renamed topic and remove/fix the links in all MSDN topics affected.

trans-unit.source: Step 7: Remove cached pages from search engines
trans-unit.target: Step 7: Remove cached pages from search engines

trans-unit.source: Go to these web pages to remove cached web pages from search engines:
trans-unit.target: Go to these web pages to remove cached web pages from search engines:

trans-unit.source: [Bing](https://www.bing.com/webmaster/tools/content-removal?rflid=1)
trans-unit.target: [Bing](https://www.bing.com/webmaster/tools/content-removal?rflid=1)

trans-unit.source: [Google](https://www.google.com/webmasters/tools/removals?pli=1)
trans-unit.target: [Google](https://www.google.com/webmasters/tools/removals?pli=1)

trans-unit.source: Contributors' guide links
trans-unit.target: Contributors' guide links

trans-unit.source: Overview article
trans-unit.target: Overview article

trans-unit.source: Index of guidance articles
trans-unit.target: Index of guidance articles
